alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; Northumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Northumberland and northern Lancaster Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 852 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lancaster, or near Robley, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kilmarnock around 900 PM EDT. Wicomico Church around 905 PM EDT. Fair Port around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lara, Browns Store, Somers, Regina, Mollusk, Alfonso, Avalon, Brook Vale, Nuttsville and Reedville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.
